intro: Clusia scandens, commonly known as the wax plant, is a tropical evergreen shrub or vine native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are typically bright green and have a glossy appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. Clusia scandens is also valued for its ability to tolerate shade and its use in traditional medicine.
